title: Spotless Pegula ends Keys’ Australian Open reign with serve of apple pie and cheese
description: Sixth seed marches into quarter-finals with 6-3, 6-4 victory while the defending champion must pay forfeit agreed on with her podcast co-host
content: While speaking on a podcast before her big match against Madison Keys, Jessica Pegula was discussing their battle last January in the Adelaide final. Keys’s performance, Pegula recalled, had prompted Pegula to accurately predict to their mutual frien... [5063 chars]

title: Children's early development at risk with year-long NHS waits
description: A quarter of the 300,000 children waiting for community NHS care have spent more than a year waiting.
content:
Tens of thousands of children in England have spent more than a year waiting for NHS community care such as hearing services, speech and language therapy and disability support, the BBC has found.
The analysis shows a quarter of the 300,000 children ... [5091 chars]

title: Murder and MI5: the extraordinary battle over what stays secret
description: Can the state, especially when it is implicated in killing, be trusted as the arbiter of what should remain confidential?
content:
Paul Thompson was shot dead while being driven home in a taxi through Belfast in April 1994. He was murdered in a sectarian attack by loyalist paramilitaries who had set out to kill Catholics.
The taxi driver was a friend who was collecting a fare at... [14332 chars]

title: ‘We got punished’: Arteta rues errors as Arsenal’s title tilt stalls with United loss
description: The Arsenal manager said after Martín Zubimendi’s mistake led to Bryan Mbeumo’s equaliser: ‘We were dominant … after that, we gave them the goal’
content:
Mikel Arteta blamed individual errors for Arsenal’s 3-2 defeat against Manchester United, on a weekend when their lead in the Premier League title race was cut to four points.

title: Russia using Interpol's wanted list to target critics abroad, leak reveals
description: A leak exposes for the first time the extent of Russia’s misuse of Interpol to request the arrest of critics.
content:
Thousands of files provided by a whistleblower at Interpol expose for the first time the extent of Russia's apparent abuse of the international policing agency to target its critics abroad.
